content.label: I fell in love with the game at level 1. Everything I was looking for in a hand held RPG. A throwback to the old dungeon crawlers of old that I have experience playing and enjoying. Around level 3 I realized that it was just a cruel joke. They've made everything so difficult you'll just get frustrated, quit, try again, repeat. Never really moving forward. I really wish they would have lightened up and made the game fun instead of a second job. Challenging is one thing, stressing out the player is another.
Such an amazing game! Incredible port from the PC!

Extremely fun and plenty of customization. Although I would have liked to see more items or a wider variety of spells, I was pleasantly surprised by this game! I hope to see more in the future for this game and from this company.

If you are a fan of the Eye of the Beholder series (or even Might and Magic or Bards Tale) you will feel right at home in the awesome homage to those titles. Really great and perfectly adapted to the iPad. Also love that it's not Freemium or Pay to Play - you get the entire game and that's it.

title.label: Like it was made for mobile devices!

content.label:
Ok, first off I played this game on PC. Was never able to beat it cause I don't have a ton of time to sit at my computer. 

Once I saw it was on IOS I jumped on it. As always, I expected this port to not be so great (as most mobile ports can be). But I gotta say, playing it on the phone, it almost seems like this is the platform that the game was made for. 

Switching weapons seems to work faster and smoother and the ability to save anywhere at anytime really heightens the experience as I can play and put the phone down in a moments notice. The original soundtrack and sound effects are all there, and as long as you have a high definition screen the game looks absolutely beautiful. 

All in all I give this 5 stars because the game was great to begin with and it seems to be even better as a mobile port. Enjoy!
Great game
I love these kinds of RPGs.  I've got 25+ hours into this and I'm still not finished.  I can't wait to play Legend of Grimrock II.  This game is easily five stars.

This is an excellent game!
Great combat system, addicting gameplay and story line not to mention the awesome graphics 
Makes me think I'm playing a newer console game.
Overall a very very good game - well spent money.
Great game. Challenging . Absorbing and lots to it.
Legend of Grimrock is a great game -- challenging puzzles and monsters and a classic old-school dungeon crawl. I just want to know when the sequel will be coming!!

title.label: Why do people love this so much?

content.label: Let's see, absolutely zero personality or story difference based on your characters. No dialogue except one sided during some dreams. Poor interface for using items in the world, casting spells and moving (moving fast and well being the difference between life and death). Identical walls everywhere. Uninteresting combat. Frustrating save system. I could go on. I don't recommend this game (obviously).
A beautiful game and extremely difficult and the hideous but just right.

Take $5 of your money, throw it in a blender, and you'll actually have more fun. 

I'd rather have crabs than play this disgusting clone of Doom with a silly backstory. 

The controls are OK, the puzzles are challenging, but the substance will actually make you dumber in the long run. 

Pray for Downs Syndrome rather than this game.
Best iOS game ever.
Do not buy this crap. One of the worst games you could ever waste five dollars on. Go get some ColdStones ice cream don't buy this filth.

title.label: Hard core RPG with a little real time action to keep you on your toes

content.label: I wish there were more of these games available.
For some reason I never got around to playing the PC version, so this is brand new to me. This is my new favorite game. The graphics, atmosphere and retro style are just what I was hoping to find.
This is one of the best games I've played on the iPad. It's just a great game period. If you think you might like it just get it!

I used to play RPG dungeon crawls all the time including Bards Tale, Eye of the Beholder, Dungeon Master almost 25 years ago. Been looking for games like that forever but they went out of style. This brings back great memories and has solid execution. I hope they make more of these. Take my money!!

I have been on a quest to find just this game. I adore Zelda and have been looking for a game iOS that is like it. The legend of Grimlock is like a Zelda dungeon. Full of puzzles to figure out, and fantastic monsters to fight. All the RPG level ups that keep you going. Without having to wait for time related level ups, or purchases, or 'playing with friends' commitments that other games ask of you. Just me and my troop of 4 figuring out in a dungeon. Love it!!!!!!

One of the best IOS games I have ever played. Mixes old school dungeon crawler with puzzles that make you really think and fun real-time combat.  First play through was 20-25 hrs, definitely worth the price!  Thanks for bringing quality games back and not more free to play junk.

Reminds me of the classic Eye of the Beholder series, which I thoroughly enjoyed.   Don't let the simple gameplay fool you, this is one of the most challenging games you will ever play.  Same basic strategies apply here as in more modern games like Diablo III and VainGlory.  Knowledge of game mechanics, effective skill allocation, resource management, kiting/positioning, and using your environment to your advantage is the only way to win.
Love LoG. I hope they can make LoG 2 for IPad app as well.

Last time I played something comparable was Dungeon Master 2 almost 20years ago. This game has essence of the old school RPG dungeons - 13levels full of creatures, puzzles and traps, spells and skilks your team members need to master and - last but not least - moments of real, existential fear for life of your party. This is how games used to be in the golden age - hard as hell, but fun and addictive...

title.label: I'm an old school RPG'er & love it.

content.label:
I cut my RPG teeth on Ultima Underworld, Might & Magic (old PC versions 1, 2, etc), AD&D on AOL, etc.
LoG was such a surprise & breath of fresh air when I started crawling around the dungeons of Grimrock! Felt right at home playing. Well worth the $$. You an old school RPG person? If so, buy this now! You won't be disappointed...

title.label: Been a while since I played a game like this

content.label: Loved everything, puzzles, fighting, strategy. Must buy game
One of the best classic D&D style games I have played in a long time.
Classic gameplay. Fun puzzles. Lots of action. Exactly what I was after.

title.label: A great *Sign in to Game Center* dungeon crawler

content.label: This is an excellent old-school *Sign in to Game Center* dungeon crawler. If you are looking for a huge dungeon game with tons of puzzle, hidden secrets, and monsters, and you like to be constantly bugged to sign in to Game Center, then this game is for you. The puzzles are tough enough to get you thinkings, but *Sign in to Game Center‚Äù have enough hints to be solvable. The graduation of *Sign in to Game Center* monster difficulties is well-matched *Sign in to Game Center* to the player XP progression, resulting in some very challenging foes that will generally fall to appropriately clever tactics. Plus, you have many, many, opportunities to sign in to Game Center. In fact, tolerating the nonstop Game Center nag screens is the most difficult task of this game.
It looks and plays much better than the impression I had from the store. I'm glad I tried it.

Okay so I love this game a lot! The only bad things are... I wish there we e a few more class and race choices. You could split the different classes into smaller ones like the fighter having an archer, a warrior and a juggernaut the archer could be quick on his feet the warrior could be average, and etc. I also wish that there was an arena or something and definetlu different dungeons with different themes. Like one being a steampunk one the other bieng a froz n ice one and another bieng a jungle one. Also random map generation would definatlwy improve the aspect of restarting. Another class idea is  the Mage bieng split up into-healer-offensive-defensiv-and support. I think this game should be on the editors choice or if u add some of the stuff me and other people have asked for maybe you could get on best new updates. You should also add a crafting thing to it it and maybe, just maybe, you could add a way that if you follow the game and finish it you can go back to town And buy stuff and enter new dungeons to get gold or find the person that accused you
I'm have having fun. That's all that matters.
Really enjoying this game. Brings me back to the 90s of good fun dungeon crawling
This game is challenging and engaging.  Great nostalgic feel, great puzzles, well worth the money.  Piece of advice, save at the beginning of each level!
Lengthy gameplay, quality character creation, and highly difficult. If you get stuck , simply ask the Internet.

I was really loving this game (did have to consult a walkthrough a couple times) until I got to the 4th level. There's only a finite amount of XP to be earned, equipment, food and spells, so the first monsters you meet in lvl 4 are too overpowered to beat. It's not like you can go back and grind to level up the characters. So now I have an app sitting there that I can't play, because I can't advance into the maze. The previous levels were challenging, but at least there was a chance to win. Hope you have better luck than I did!

It started pretty cool, kinda like Morrowind! But there is too much to manage for a tablet game; gotta find weapons and clothes, constantly refresh torches, finding food is a betch and the puzzle like tricks to progress through the maze , and then there are the monsters that poison you and you have to constantly run back to a crystal to resurrect your fallen team members. Sheeez!  Delete.
Great

title.label: Challenging and fun but has a few issues

content.label:
I've had a lot of fun playing LoG. Reminds me of that old Eye of the Beholder series.

One thing that is really annoying is that some groups of mobs can only really be defeated by gimmicks such as going around in circles on a 2 by 2 grid or opening and closing a door. I don't like this as it kills the RPG elements completely for me. Also, I'm playing on normal and some mob groups can only be defeated this way. 

Another glaring omission from the game is lack of iCloud support. Would love to be able to pick up where I left off on either my iPhone or iPad. Sadly I'm stuck with whatever save games are stored locally.
Got to lvl 4. Updated. Now it insta-crashes.

This game features many innovative puzzles, some excellent combat and is overall very well polished.  I think the character leveling could be expanded with branching skill trees like Etrian odyssey or spell mixing like Magika.  I've played the sequel briefly on PC and hope it comes to IPad.
Great game, much like older dungeon crawlers like ultimate underworld. No add ins required to win, just spells, melee, and logic to get you out.

title.label: Amiga Dungeon Master in the palm of your hand

content.label: Brilliant execution of a retro gaming experience - Grimrock grips you from the beginning - from the restart at the end of the first level when you realize you didn't create your characters just so to the guilty save and try try again at the tougher areas.  And don't forget the long periods of starvation as you desperately try to find food.  The secrets within secrets are similarly fiendish and fun.  Highly recommended - expect to be addicted and looking forward to that next level up to add more skills.
I am absolutely addicted to this game, the puzzles are great, the combat feels powerful, the spells and magic are amazing, but there I only have one question. Why is this game a whole gigabyte?
Takes me back to childhood with my Apple lle and floppy disk of Wizardry. I wanna stay in this pit forever. Adventures, puzzles and monsters, what more can you want ? Expansion packs iap

This game is so awesome, epic, and amazing!!!!!! I haven't finished the first one, but I know when I do, I'll be DYING to play the second one!!!! I'm begging you to please put it on the AppStore!!!!! I would buy it no matter the cost, I watched the trailer for it....and it looks sooooooooo awesome!!!!!!!

title.label: I would love to play, but . . .

content.label:
I got down to the second level, moderately well equipped, and was immensely enjoying the game, when it suddenly froze.  After several game and device restarts, I am still unable to play for more than a minute or two without the game freezing.
Please fix this issue.
Must Have for RPG Fans

The game is Great! Period. 

I just love dungeons like these. Reminds me of Ultima Underworld and Phantasy Star I

That being said, I miss more: classes, battle styles, spells, puzzles, etc.
Lots of fun to play. As a bonus, it works very well on my antiquated iPad 2.
